resources.string: Click on \'Reload\' symbol to reset the canvas
Congratulations! You have answered all questions of this category. Please press \'Okay\' and then \'Save progress\' to exit.
You can\'t go back from here
Please press Save progress to exit
Congratulations! You did it absolutely right!
This is not a valid answer! Try again.
Unable to add user, please try again...
Hey folk! You misunderstood addition as multiplication! The symbol to be used here is \'+\' and not \'x\'. We\'ve added 3 more questions for you to try and rectify this mistake, all the best!

Hey folk! You almost got it correct but missed a carry digit. If sum of two digits of a number is more than 9, the concept of carry comes into the picture. We\'ve added 3 more questions for you to try and rectify this mistake, all the best!

Hey folk! 6 is six which means the number of A\'s you see now -> AAAAAA and 9 is nine which is number of A\'s you see now -> AAAAAAAAA. You surely understand 6 to be 9 and 9 to be 6. We\'ve added 3 more questions for you to try and remove this confusion, all the best!

Hey folk! 1 is one which means the number of A\'s you see now -> A and 7 is seven which is number of A\'s you see now -> AAAAAAA. You surely understand 1 to be 7 and 7 to be 1. We\'ve added 3 more questions for you to try and remove this confusion, all the best!

Hey folk! 6 is six which means the number of A\'s you see now -> AAAAAA and 9 is nine which is number of A\'s you see now -> AAAAAAAAA. 1 is one which means the number of A\'s you see now -> A and 7 is seven which is number of A\'s you see now -> AAAAAAA. You surely understand 1 to be 7, 7 to be 1, 6 to be 9 and 9 to be 6. We\'ve added 3 more questions for you to try and remove these confusions, all the best!
Hey folk! You have performed left to right addition, whereas addition is always right to left. We\'ve added 3 more questions for you to try and rectify this mistake, all the best!

Hey folk! You have almost got it right, but missed a 0 at the end. You may think that 0 is an insignificant digit. If 0 appears after a digit it is not insignificant. We\'ve added 3 more questions for you to try and remove this confusion, all the best!

Hey folk! You have almost got it right, but missed a 0 in middle. You may think that 0 is an insignificant digit. If 0 appears after a digit it is not insignificant. We\'ve added 3 more questions for you to try and remove this confusion, all the best!
Hey folk! You misunderstood \'-\' as \'+\' and added the number instead of subtracting them. We\'ve added 3 more questions for you to try and rectify this mistake, all the best!
Hey folk! You misunderstood subtraction as division and divided the numbers instead of subtracting them. We\'ve added 3 more questions for you to try and rectify this mistake, all the best!

Hey folk! You probably have a problem in borrowing digits. When you take 1 as borrow from a place, the digit at that place reduces by one. We\'ve added 3 more questions for you to try and rectify this mistake, all the best!

Hey folk! You have almost got it right, but missed 0 at the end. You may think that 0 is an insignificant digit. If 0 appears after a digit it is not insignificant. We\'ve added 3 more questions for you to try and remove this confusion, all the best!
Hey folk! You misunderstood \'x\' as \'+\' and added the number instead of multiplying them. We\'ve added 3 more questions for you to try and rectify this mistake, all the best!

Hey folk! You have a problem in understanding place values and you did the shifting of numbers while adding them after multiplication. We\'ve added 3 more questions for you to try and rectify this mistake, all the best!
Hey folk! You misunderstood 0 as 1. 0 x any number is always 0 and 1 x any number is always the number itself. We\'ve added 3 more questions for you to try and remove this confusion, all the best!
Hey folk! You have misunderstood division as multiplication. We\'ve added 3 more questions for you to try and rectify this error, all the best!

Hey folk! You have almost got it right, but reversed the actual answer. The quotient is to be written left to right and not right to left. We\'ve added 3 more questions for you to try and rectify this error, all the best!

Hey folk! You have almost got it right, but missed a 0 in the middle of the quotient. You may think that 0 is an insignificant digit. If 0 appears after a digit it is not insignificant. We\'ve added 3 more questions for you to try and remove this confusion, all the best!

Hey folk! You have divided the number with just one of the digits. You should be dividing it with the complete divisor. We\'ve added 3 more questions for you to try and rectify this error, all the best!
Hey folk! You almost got it correct but answered remainder instead of quotient. We\'ve added 3 more questions for you to try and rectify this error, all the best!
Hey folk! You have misunderstood division as subtraction. We\'ve added 3 more questions for you to try and rectify this error, all the best!
Hey folk! You have misunderstood division as addition. We\'ve added 3 more questions for you to try and rectify this error, all the best!
